summaryOfNewsArticle: This article examines the cultural value of traditional festivals in rural China, emphasizing their role in maintaining community identity and heritage. Through detailed field observations, the authors illustrate how festivals such as the Spring Festival and the Mid-Autumn Festival are not just celebrations but vital expressions of cultural continuity. The study highlights the importance of community participation in preserving these traditions and calls for increased government and institutional support to ensure their long-term sustainability.
title: Preserving the Soul: Traditional Festivals in Rural China
